author: A_Brickset_user
title: Tiny but cute!
review: When I first saw Kohrak Va, it made me laugh. It looks so funny and cute! The eyes seem too big for its head, which makes it look kinda cartoony. And the Bohrok teeth for hooks make it seem like Gali Jr. or something. Overall, it's so cute that it's sure to become famous! Oh, and by the way, the mask doodad is called a Krana.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Nice...
review: i got this guy when i bought the whole lot of 6. This guy is my second fav Va to lehvak which i like cus of the swords.His two ice Picks are "cute" bohrok teeth and i like the head plate. Akso i like his ability to fling krana even if he is only a scout.

author: Gus_263
title: Va of ice
review: My favorite bohrok shield is in this set, the eyes of korahk, tohunga feet, a krana and bohrok teeth. A little version of bohrok very cool to play, being a usable set. Like the turaga, the arms aren't very too poseable.

author: mvila09
title: 8551 Kohrak Va
review: Kohrak Va is very cool and amazing.I really love his weapons.Pros:Nice head,Good choice of weapons,Cool blue eyes,White Krana!,Kohrak's head can pivot from side to side.Cons:Krana falls out alot,Big feet.But, I'm glad I took the time to build and review this set.*****5 stars.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Good companion for Kohrak
review:
He's small, cute, and pretty posable and playable despite his size.  I like the picks in his hands and the way you can catapult the Krana on his back.  The head can turn in any direction, and can move up and down as well.  So, in a nutshell, what does this little guy score?

Pros:

Picks

One arm can move up and down, while the other catapults the Krana

Head is very posable

You can move his body to crouch, sit, and stand upright

Good companion to Kohrak

Cons:

Big feet

So, all in all, he scores a five out of five.  Thanks for reading!! :D

author: Odeinoichus
title: Kohrok Va stands ready to assist Kohrok
review:
Set #8551 Kohrok Va: The Bohrok Va were all pretty much the same basic model, the only things which changed were the colors, the head piece and the Krana.

 

Kohrok Va, in fact all Bohrok Va have interesting looking aesthethics. However the models can not stand straight as the Krana will fall out of their back flipping panels if you try to stand them up straight. The pieces are useful though as spares for the larger Bohrok or if you wanted to you could try and combine all six of them into a deadly gestalt. (The instructions don't indicate this though.)

 

As I said though you can do without these little impulse sets in your collection if you're looking to trim area for space or something.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Bohrok Va) - Kohrak Va Review
review:
This is a great little figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has only two pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has 28 pieces and it was 3 USD when it was on sale. The price per piece ratio was 11 cents per piece which is a good value for a figure like this!

The build

The build is very fun and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8551-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the head, the feet and the torso can be moved. On both hands you can see a pickaxe which LEGO used as teeth for the bohrok figures. The back of the bohrok va has a piece where you can put a krana in as well. I really can't complain about this little figure - even if this set doesn't do much.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
